alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast; San Miguel and Santa Rosa Islands; Santa Cruz and Anacapa Islands; Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued September 08 at 9:37AM PDT until September 11 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 5 to 8 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Ventura County Beaches, Malibu Coast, Los Angeles County Beaches, San Miguel and Santa Rosa Islands and Santa Cruz and Anacapa Islands. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 5 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. Pooling of sea water is possible around high tide at beach and harbor areas that is uncommon with normal tidal ranges. Enhanced beach erosion is also possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Along with the high surf, minor to moderate coastal flooding will be possible around high tide for vulnerable, south-facing coastlines. High tides will occur each evening between 5.4 and 6.0 feet MLLW.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast; San Miguel and Santa Rosa Islands; Santa Cruz and Anacapa Islands; Ventura County Beaches
